definition: Zhang Hua (232-300), Western Jin writer, poet and politician/Zhang Hua (1958-1982), student held up as a martyr after he died saving an old peasant from a septic tank/other Zhang Hua's too numerous to mention
surname Zhang
to open up/to spread/sheet of paper/classifier for flat objects, sheet/classifier for votes
Mt Hua 華山|华山 in Shaanxi/surname Hua
abbr. for China
magnificent/splendid/flowery
old variant of 花[hua1]/flower

sentences.english: Zhang Hua quickly ran back to his flat and poured water over his jacket.
sentences.chinese: 張華迅速的跑回他的公寓，並用水弄溼他的夾克。

sentences.english: Let me introduce myself first. My name is Zhang Hua.
sentences.chinese: 我先自我介紹一下，我叫張華。

sentences.english: Zhang Hua left Taicang Normal School eight years ago.
sentences.chinese: 張華八年前畢業於太倉師範師範學校。

sentences.english: Zhanghua and Liping passed the exam. What about the other students?
sentences.chinese: 張華和李平通過了考試，其他的學生怎麼樣？

sentences.english: In the Taikang period , Zhang Hua play an important role.
sentences.chinese: 第四章論述張華在晉初詩風演變過程中所起到的作用。

sentences.english: During this visit, Mr Zhang Hua and Mr Huang has given presents to each other.
sentences.chinese: 期間，張華董事長還和黃南美老先生互贈了禮品。

sentences.english: Here is Zhang Hua's family photo.
sentences.chinese: 這是關於張華家庭的照片。

sentences.english: Who do you like better, Li Ming or Zhang Hua?
sentences.chinese: 李明和張華，你較喜歡誰？

sentences.english: He is sitting between Zhang Hua and me.
Gavin Zhang was admitted to practice PRC laws in 1997.
sentences.chinese: 張華律師自1997年開始律師執業。

sentences.english: Zhang Hua is with NTO of China based in Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 張華在中國旅遊公司駐東京分公司工作。

sentences.english: Whats wrong with you, Zhang Hua?

definition: to discuss
well-rounded argument/general survey

same as 舊唐書|旧唐书[Jiu4 Tang2 shu1], History of the Early Tang Dynasty, sixteenth of the 24 dynastic histories 二十四史[Er4 shi2 si4 Shi3], compiled under Liu Xu 劉昫|刘昫[Liu2 Xu4] in 945 during Later Jin 後晉|后晋[Hou4 Jin4] of the Five Dynasties, 200 scrolls
Zhao, one of the seven states during the Warring States Period of Chinese history (475-220 BC)
to revise/to examine and revise
to check and correct
On learning, classic book by Confucian philosopher Xun Zi 荀子 (c. 310-237 BC)
the Three Su father and sons (referring to Northern Song literati Su Xun 蘇洵|苏洵[Su1 Xun2], Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼[Su1 Shi4] and Su Zhe 蘇轍|苏辙[Su1 Zhe2])
Tao Zongyi (c. 1329-1410), Yuan dynasty scholar
Ji Yun (1724-1805), Qing Dynasty writer, author of supernatural novel Notes on a Minutely Observed Thatched Hut 閱微草堂筆記|阅微草堂笔记
Sunwu county in Heihe 黑河[Hei1 he2], Heilongjiang
“Six Secret Strategic Teachings”, one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1], attributed to Jiang Ziya 姜子牙[Jiang1 Zi3 ya2]
Zou Yan (305-240 BC), founder of the School of Yin-Yang of the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
Southwest University (Chongqing)
a book on the art of war
